answers.question: Telegram Handle We Can Use To Contact You
Link to your Public Group Chat

answers.answer: We have participated in the previous rounds: GG21, GG22
answers.question: Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.

answers.answer: Our project is fully open source. Also, we have hundreds of OSS projects on our platform that receive lot of visibility and help them get more funding from various funding platforms.
answers.question: How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.

answers.answer:
Our dApp is used by a wide category of applications to share progress updates with their funders. We also have integration with various analytics services and our own custom analytics to track Github and onchain activity of the projects. Funders can evaluate individual project activity and outcomes and also their entire program activity. 

We have implemented a popular Impact measurement framework called Common Approach which is used in the traditional grant space which is receiving adoption from various communities. 

All of the data is stored onchain and anyone can build applications or do analytics of all the data permissionlessly.

Our new Karma AI is a chat assistant the funders can use to evaluate projects, their updates, activity, outcomes and determine funding.
answers.question: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?

answers.answer: Grant funds will be used to build more features. We are focusing on Karma AI to assist Gitcoin and other funders to easily discover high impact projects and fund them. We would like to double down on Karma AI and improve it's functionality. We also want to onboard more OSS communities to GAP.
answers.question: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?

For any project deploying smart contracts on blockchain networks, please list all your deployer addresses and their corresponding blockchain networks. Use this format for each entry: [deployer_address], [chain_id]â€”for example, 0x123abc..., 42161 (This represents a deployer address on the Arbitrum network). Please include a separate line for each unique deployer address and blockchain combination.

project.title: Karma GAP
project.description:
Karma GAP (Grantee Accountability Protocol) is an onchain protocol and application that can be used by grantees to share their project progress, update the community on how the funds are being utilized and build reputation. 

Grant teams and donors can get visibility into various projects they have funded, follow their progress and hold them accountable.

Grantees can create their project, grant and milestones in GAP. They can post updates  to keep the community updated. All the information is stored onchain.

We have an SDK that can be used by anyone to build an alternative UI, fetch data for further analysis or build tools on top of this protocol.
